item.title: Python Temperature Conversion
item.description: Convert Temperature Units Using a Python Script #!/usr/bin/python3 temp = input("Input the temperature you like to convert? (e.g., 45F, 102C etc.) : ") degree = int(temp[:-1]) i_convention = temp[-1] if i_convention.upper() == "C": result = int(round((9 * degree) / 5 + 32)) o_convention = "Fahrenheit" elif i_convention.upper() == "F": result = int(round((degree - 32) * 5 / 9)) o_convention = "Celsius" else: print("Input proper convention.
